text: [Music]
meet the drone builder turned pilot who

build a personal flying vehicle based
off of drone technology watch the
ultralight vehicle propelled itself

see how it could answer the call for
autonomous vehicles in the traffic
ridden metropolis of the inventors
native Philippines
Kix Mendiola always wanted a sports car
now he has something better Hicks's
dream of flying something of his own
make would take him six years and
millions of his own pesos 16 motors it
has 16 propellers 16 computers kicks his
personal vehicle is nothing short of a
triumph he claims to be the first person
in the Philippines with a car capable of
vertical takeoff and landing and the
inventor of the smallest flying car in
the world I started loving drones so I
started building drones for the film
industry I slowly realized that this
technology is so cool and it's so safe
and I started planning on making a drone
that can carry me crazy concept the
Millenial was very difficult I had to
start from scratch I had to learn
everything on my own

of the concept of millennia wielding
better materials better techniques and

his first seated hover vehicle was not
much more than a seat strapped to a
metal frame with propellers Kix knew he
could do better his second personal
flying vehicle used spars that held the
propellers out from the body of the
vehicle this propeller layout offered
more control and stability a similar
propeller layout would go into the
concepto Millenia the final version of
the aircraft is all-electric it's
powered by batteries which require two
and a half hours to charge and as of now
it can fly for 12 to 15 minutes at a
time
it may not be commercially viable
without a few more tweaks but even in
its current state it looks like it could

destination there is a lot of potential
for the personalized aircraft especially
in kicks his native Philippines in 2016
popular navigation app Waze ranks Manila
